title: Business & Finance
text:
Exxon's remade board is debating whether to continue with several major oil and gas projects as the company reconsiders its investment strategy.

---

Tesla notched a third consecutive record quarterly profit, thanks in part to its ability to navigate global supply-chain disruptions.

---

Bitcoin's price hit a record a day after the first U.S. ETF linked to the cryptocurrency started trading.

---

The S&P 500 and Dow both rose 0.4%, while the Nasdaq slipped 0.05%.

---

China Evergrande called off plans to sell a majority stake in its property-management unit.

---

Activist investor Elliott has a big stake in Canadian National Railway, adding to pressure on the railroad.

---

IBM reported weaker-than-expected revenue for the third quarter.

---

The District of Columbia's attorney general is seeking to hold Facebook's Zuckerberg personally liable in a lawsuit stemming from the Cambridge Analytica scandal.
